alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 12:46PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southeastern Coos... northeastern Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties... At 1245 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was 8 miles west of Mount Washington, or 10 miles east of Bethlehem...moving east AT 35 MPH. Locations impacted include... Conway, Bethlehem, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Carroll, Gorham, Bartlett, Jefferson, Jackson, Chatham, Randolph, Hart`s Location and Whitefield. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, Mount Jefferson, Mount Madison, Mount Eisenhower, and Wildcat Mountain. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
